nodes.text: Sometime between 3667 and 3653 BBY, during the Great Galactic War between the Galactic Republic and the Sith Empire, the Chagrian Fideltin Rusk fought in a battle on the planet Amador. During the fighting, the Republic Military soldier defended the single entrance of a fortress by himself, and by the time the Republic emerged victorious, Rusk had killed enough Imperial soldiers to stack their bodies in a wall twenty corpses high. When Rusk visited the Shrine of Healing on the planet Voss well over a decade later, he was reminded of the fortress and the fighting on Amador.

The battle on Amador is mentioned only once in the 2011 BioWare-LucasArts video game Star Wars: The Old Republic, in the ambient conversation that is triggered when the Jedi Knight companion character Fideltin Rusk is near the Shrine of Healing.
